node.title: Breaking through Russia's digital Iron Curtain
node.description: Inaugurated during the Cold War, Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty broadcasts news to countries where freedom of the press is under assault – and with Russia shutting down independent news sources, its mission is even more critical.

node.title: Another Russian quagmire: Putin and the shadow of Afghanistan
node.description: In 1979 the Soviet Union invaded Afghanistan to install a puppet regime; they were defeated after a 10-year fight against rebels armed by the CIA. Now, the Kremlin's failure to install a puppet government in Ukraine has exposed weaknesses in its military.

node.title: Second "black box" found from China Eastern plane crash that killed 132
node.description: Firefighters taking part in the search found the flight data recorder on a mountain slope about 130 feet from the point of impact and 5 feet underground.

node.title: Biden on Putin: 'For God's sake, this man cannot remain in power'
node.description: US President Joe Biden says that Russia's invasion of Ukraine threatened to unravel global security, and that the world's democracies must prepare for a long fight against autocracy.

node.title: Academic and activist Dr Cat Pausé has died
node.description: The Massey University lecturer - who specialised in fat studies and body stigma - has passed away.

node.title: A special night at Mt Smart, but what about the TV ratings?
node.description: Analysis - Mt Smart Stadium is now home to the season's biggest upset after Moana Pasifika seized a historic upset win against the Hurricanes, Jamie Wall writes. Video

node.title: Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins dies
node.description: Taylor Hawkins, the drummer for Grammy-winning rock band Foo Fighters, has died at age 50. Audio

node.title: Goats successfully eradicated at Taranaki national park
node.description: Goats have finally been eliminated from Te Papakura o Taranaki, formerly known as Egmont National Park.

node.title: Data migration business intent on expansion after funding boost
node.description: A Christchurch tech start-up is eyeing up growth in the Asia-Pacific and the United States after securing funding.

node.title: Biden to propose minimum tax on households worth over $100 million
node.description: The 20% minimum tax would apply to households worth over $100 million, those in the top 0.01% of households.

node.title: Auckland mayor denies claim fuel tax funds are sitting unused
node.description: Most of Auckland's regional fuel tax funds have not been spent, the National Party says, but Auckland's mayor is rubbishing the claim.

node.title: Prosecutor: Child killer's release from prison a "huge gamble"
node.description: Eric Smith, who was just 13 when he strangled and beat to death 4-year-old Derrick Robie, was released on parole after 28 years behind bars. Has he changed?

node.title: 'Shame on you': How Zelensky uses speeches to get what he needs
node.description: While his army has fought tenaciously on the battlefields of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelensky has waged an information war on the capitals of the Western world.

node.title: Afghanistan: Protesters urge Taliban to reopen girls' schools
node.description: About two dozen protesters gathered close to the Taliban's Ministry of Education on Saturday morning, calling on the group to reopen girls' secondary schools.

node.title: Florida man tries to use COVID-19 as a cover for murder
node.description: Digital evidence stored in the cloud was critical to solving the case.

node.title: Construction worker killed in partial collapse of Boston parking garage
node.description: The worker appeared to be working in a small crane that fell about eight or none stories, officials said.

node.title: Crusaders back in charge
node.description: A second-half momentum shift led the Crusaders to an exhilarating 34-19 win over the Chiefs in a blockbuster Super Rugby Pacific clash in Hamilton.

node.title: 'He always said we're all humans and we're all the same'
node.description: World War II veteran John Sato, who came to prominence after taking four buses to join an anti-racism march in 2019, has died at the age of 98. Video

node.title: Contractors work to clear slips and landslides in Tairāwhiti region
node.description: Civil Defence is today delivering vital supplies to Gisborne residents cut off by the week's severe flooding, while contractors work to clear slips and landslides in the Tairāwhiti region.

node.title: Taylor Hawkins had 10 substances in his system when he died, officials say
node.description: Hawkins, 50, died in his hotel room in Bogotá, Colombia, on Friday, shortly before the Foo Fighters were set to perform.

node.title: Justice's wife urged Trump White House to overturn 2020 election -report
node.description: The wife of a US conservative Supreme Court Judge urged Trump's chief of staff to try to overturn the 2020 election results, the Washington Post and CBS News say.

node.title: Polyfest 2022: 'I feel like I performed with my whole heart'
node.description: The world's biggest Māori and Pacific Islands cultural festival kicked off in Tāmaki Makaurau this week, but with no crowds for the first time.

node.title: Nebraska congressman Jeff Fortenberry announces resignation after guilty verdict
node.description: A California jury last week convicted Fortenberry of lying to federal authorities about an illegal campaign donation from a foreign national.

node.title: White Ferns in bittersweet win
node.description: The White Ferns ended their World Cup campaign with an emphatic 71-run win over Pakistan at Hagley Oval in Christchurch.

node.title: Kiwi UFC star Kai Kara-France hoping to celebrate in style
node.description: UFC title contender Kai Kara-France couldn't be more sure what he wants for his 29th birthday.

node.title: Hallenstein Glasson reports first half profit drop due to Covid-19 disruptions
node.description: Clothing retailer Hallenstein Glasson has posted a 40 percent fall in first half profit as Covid lockdowns on both sides of the Tasman shut shops and dented sales.

node.title: We're going to need more popcorn - movies are getting longer and longer
node.description: It's not just your imagination - blockbusters are getting more and more bloated at the box office.

node.title: Joe Biden visits US troops near Ukrainian border
node.description: US President Joe Biden has personally thanked American troops stationed in Poland, near the border with Ukraine, during his tour of Europe.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 20 deaths, 14,175 community cases, 841 in hospital
node.description: New Zealand's Covid-19 hospitalisation numbers have fallen sharply again, but the death toll has risen by another 20 people today, with 14,175 new community cases also reported.

node.title: Kristin Crowley sworn in as L.A. Fire Department's first female fire chief
node.description: She will lead the nation's third-largest firefighting force.
